item.title: Tonya add a quote by Dylan Thomas
item.description: "And when the firemen turned off the hose and were standing in the wet, smoky room, Jim's Aunt, Miss. Prothero, came downstairs and peered in at them. Jim and I waited, very quietly, to hear what she would say to them. She said the right thing, always. She looked at the three tall firemen in their shining helmets, standing among the smoke and cinders and dissolving snowballs, and she said, "Would you like anything to read?" -- Dylan Thomas

item.title: Tonya add a quote by Garth Nix
item.description: "Yep," said Arthur. Somehow <i>yep</i> seemed the most positive thing he could say. Stronger than <i>yeah</i> and more heroic than <i>yes</i>. He hoped he could live up to it." -- Garth Nix
